alert.note: Alert for Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 20 at 3:51PM MDT until March 22 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MONDAY TO MIDNIGHT MDT MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 9 inches with the heaviest amounts on Bartlett and Johnson Mesas. North winds could gust as high as 60 mph Monday evening. * WHERE...Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass. * WHEN...From 6 AM Monday to Midnight MDT Monday Night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes portions of I-25 between Raton and Raton Pass. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility resulting in near blizzard conditions. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Drifts up to 1 foot deep possible, except up to 2 feet at the higher elevations. Areas of blowing snow will produce near whiteout conditions at times Monday afternoon and night.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
